result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blerim Rrahmani

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered case dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Requesting for modification of the No Contact order. Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Plea & Sentencing date. Defense cousnel request case be adjourned to be addressed the new case 15CM1672 with this matter for a global resolution. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Genavie G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant informed the Public Defender's office that he is hiring Private Counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/14/15 @ 1:30 pm
